# Your turn

## Use your YAML instead

You just used the drop-down `r emo::ji("yarn")` **Knit** button to knit to Word and PDF. Now try changing your YAML to:

```{r echo=FALSE}
yml_empty() %>% 
  yml_author("Your name here") %>% 
  yml_title("Your title here") %>% 
  yml_output(html_document(toc = TRUE, toc_float = TRUE, theme = "flatly"), 
             word_document(toc = TRUE), 
             pdf_document()) %>% 
  asis_yaml_output()
```

Now click `r emo::ji("yarn")` **Knit** - what do you notice?

# Table One

arsenal (need `knitr` asis options)

```{r results='asis'}
mockdata %>% 
  tableby(arm ~ age, data = .) %>% 
  summary(digits = 2, digits.p = 3, digits.pct=1, 
          pfootnote=TRUE,
          title = "Table One: Demographics")
```

---

.pull-left[

```{r}
mockdata_gender <- mockdata %>% 
  tableby(arm ~ sex, data = .) %>% 
  summary(digits = 2, digits.p = 3, digits.pct=1, 
          pfootnote=TRUE,
          title = "Table One: Demographics")
labels(mockdata_gender) <- c(sex = "Gender")
```
]

.pull-right[
```{r results='asis'}
mockdata_gender
```
]

# Your turn

## Spruce up the tables

pick one table to include?
+ Not fond of so many decimal places?
+ Edit the summary function to add `digit` arguments between the parentheses,
like `digits = 2, digits.p = 3, digits.pct=1`
+ You can also edit the labels for the variables in the labels function.

To exclude, use your `knitr` code chunk options (do not delete!)

add text to frame the table and what it is showing

```{r echo = FALSE}
countdown(minutes = 5)
```

an adverse events table

maybe do some fancier regex worthy stuff to be able to cast all of the adverse events as factors easily

that was a good test- see how tableone deals with factors versus numbers

think about when pfootnote should be TRUE

```{r results='asis'}
mockdata <- mockdata %>% 
  mutate(low_wbc = as.factor(low_wbc))
labels(mockdata) <- c(age = "Age, years", sex = "Gender")
mockdata %>% 
  tableby(arm ~ low_wbc + neuropathy + blood_clot, data = .) %>% 
  summary(digits = 2, digits.p = 3, digits.pct=1, 
          pfootnote=FALSE,
          title = "Table One: Demographics") ->
table_two
table_two
```
